trans-unit.source: Retrieve or set the current value in milliseconds _IELoadWait() will try before timing out

seg-source.mrk: Retrieve or set the current value in milliseconds _IELoadWait() will try before timing out

target.mrk: Retrieve or set the current value in milliseconds _IELoadWait() will try before timing out

trans-unit.source: [optional] retrieve or specify the number of milliseconds

seg-source.mrk: retrieve or specify the number of milliseconds

target.mrk: retrieve or specify the number of milliseconds

trans-unit.source: 0 or positive integer sets timeout to this value

seg-source.mrk: 0 or positive integer sets timeout to this value

target.mrk: 0 or positive integer sets timeout to this value

trans-unit.source: -1 = (Default) returns the current timeout value (stored in global variable $__IELoadWaitTimeout)

seg-source.mrk: -1 = (Default) returns the current timeout value (stored in global variable $__IELoadWaitTimeout)

target.mrk: -1 = (Default) returns the current timeout value (stored in global variable $__IELoadWaitTimeout)

trans-unit.source: Returns the current timeout value if $iTimeout = -1, else returns 1.

seg-source.mrk: Returns the current timeout value if $iTimeout = -1, else returns 1.

target.mrk: Returns the current timeout value if $iTimeout = -1, else returns 1.

trans-unit.source: There is no way to completely disable the Timeout value.

seg-source.mrk: There is no way to completely disable the Timeout value.

target.mrk: There is no way to completely disable the Timeout value.

trans-unit.source: You can functionally do this however by setting it to a very large positive integer.

seg-source.mrk: You can functionally do this however by setting it to a very large positive integer.

target.mrk: You can functionally do this however by setting it to a very large positive integer.

trans-unit.source: The initial timeout value is 30000 ms (5 minutes).

seg-source.mrk: The initial timeout value is 30000 ms (5 minutes).

target.mrk: The initial timeout value is 30000 ms (5 minutes).
